hypothesis_content.title: Fade of Panic Selling in BEAR/STRESS Regime Using Volatility Contraction
hypothesis_content.statement: In BEAR or STRESS regimes, following a day where BTC price drops more than -8% on volume > 150% of its 20-day average, if the next day's trading range (High-Low) is less than 50% of the panic day's range, a long position at the close will yield a positive return within 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A massive down day on high volume can represent a capitulation event. A sharply narrowed range the next day indicates selling pressure has been exhausted. This is a classic 'selling climax' pattern, offering a high-risk, high-reward contrarian long.
entry_conditions: Day T: BTC daily return < -8% AND volume > 150% of 20D avg volume
Day T+1: (Daily High - Daily Low) < 0.5 * (Day T High - Day T Low)
Enter long at the close of Day T+1

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below the low of Day T (panic day)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average 3-day return after the entry condition is not positive, or the stop-loss is hit more than 40% of the time.
